decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing cycling and cascade mechanics to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Architects of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By cycling through cards and cascading into Living End, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck revolves around assembling a variety of creatures with different abilities to create a powerful toolbox. By using cards like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures, the deck aims to control the board and generate value through sacrifice effects and synergy between creatures. The inclusion of cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician allows for combo potential and the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes some utility lands to support the creature toolbox strategy.

This deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures with different abilities to create powerful combo plays. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can search for specific creatures to deal with different board states effectively. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to generate value and create a strong board presence. With a mix of ramp, removal, and resilient creatures, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in the mid to late game.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize a mix of burn spells, cheap creatures, and card advantage to quickly deal damage to the opponent. With a focus on casting inexpensive spells and synergizing with prowess abilities, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game as quickly as possible. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds additional versatility to the deck while maintaining its aggressive strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's fast-paced gameplay while maximizing consistency.

Utilizing the graveyard and artifacts to set up a powerful combo that can win the game quickly through a combination of cards like Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, Mishra's Bauble, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. The deck aims to efficiently mill through the library, generate mana, and ultimately win the game through either decking the opponent or using Thassa's Oracle as a win condition. Support cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Unholy Heat help control the board and protect the combo pieces, while Urza's Saga provides additional value and consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to maximize the number of +1/+1 counters placed on creatures, particularly Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and Arcbound Ravager. This allows for aggressive plays and quick win conditions, taking advantage of cards like Urza's Saga, Walking Ballista, and Inkmoth Nexus. The deck also includes support cards like Welding Jar and Pendelhaven to protect key cards. The inclusion of artifacts like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and The One Ring provide additional synergy with the Hardened Scales strategy, making it a powerhouse in 1 vs 1 Modern matchups.

This deck is designed to be an aggressive powerhouse, utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to take control of the game. With a focus on utilizing powerful cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf, this Jund Aggro deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt opposing strategies. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push allows for disruption and removal, while cards like Wrenn and Six provide value and consistency. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently, utilizing its resources to maintain board control and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's hand and board state. Utilizing cards like Grief and Thoughtseize to strip the opponent's hand of valuable cards while cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters apply pressure on the opponent. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker add powerful late-game threats, while removal spells like Terminate, Fatal Push, and Lightning Bolt help control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive plays and disruption.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and control the game. It utilizes counterspells like Force of Negation and Condescend to disrupt the opponent's plays, while also including creatures like Horned Loch-Whale and Tishana's Tidebinder for board presence. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and artifact removal, making it difficult for opponents to establish their own game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist. It also uses black and white disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Grief to control the opponent's hand and board. Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide card advantage and graveyard manipulation to ensure the combo can be executed efficiently. The deck aims to reanimate creatures at instant speed while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and create a game-winning board state. The deck also includes various ways to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The inclusion of Persist and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds redundancy to the combo and ensures consistency in executing the game plan. The mana base is optimized to support the combo and provide flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to surprise opponents with its unique approach and creative combo potential.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful combos and synergies. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to tutor for specific creatures, while also utilizing cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Agatha's Soul Cauldron for extra value and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a toolbox of creatures that can disrupt their game plan and secure victory. With access to key pieces like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons, this deck has the potential to generate incredible value and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on using Martyr of Sands to gain life quickly, while also using cards like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude to control the board. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage through Ranger-Captain of Eos and Abiding Grace, while also having a backup plan with Emeria, the Sky Ruin to recur creatures. The deck also includes some land destruction with Field of Ruin and Demolition Field, as well as protection with Reprieve and Kami of False Hope. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive while maintaining a resilient board state.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to be able to play powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. The combination of land tutoring cards like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West, along with land bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf, allows for explosive plays. The goal is to get multiple copies of Primeval Titan onto the field to search for powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva, enabling a massive amount of damage to be dealt in a single turn.

The focus of this deck is to assemble a versatile toolbox of creatures that can be tutored for using Chord of Calling. Yawgmoth, Thran Physician acts as a central combo piece, providing card draw and creature removal. Grist, the Hunger Tide and Wall of Roots help to generate value and mana acceleration, while other creatures like Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons and Delighted Halfling offer additional synergy and utility. The deck aims to create advantageous board states, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game with a powerful combination of creatures and abilities.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a combination of disruptive spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent's resources. Cards like Thoughtseize and Grief are used to disrupt the opponent's hand while Orcish Bowmasters and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse are used as aggressive threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push to deal with any threats the opponent may play. The mana base is built to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.
